at.ac.tuwien.infosys.g2021.daemon

Interface HardwareDriverInterface

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Component
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DummyHardwareDriverImplementation, RaspberryPiI2CDemoHardwareDriverImplementation, UnitTestDriverImplementation

    public interface HardwareDriverInterface
extends Component
    Every driver for hardware devices must implement this interface.

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from interface at.ac.tuwien.infosys.g2021.daemon.Component

        initialize, release, shutdown

    • Method Detail

      • isSuitable

        boolean isSuitable()
        Is this a suitable hardware driver and can this driver work with the current hardware?

        This method is used to select the current hardware driver of the daemon. It must not throw an exception in any case! If this methods return false, no other methods of this driver are called.

        Returns:
        true, if this is a suitable driver

      • isBestChoice

        boolean isBestChoice()
        Is this hardware driver is the best choice for this hardware? If this method returns false and another driver is also suitable, the other driver will be used.
        Returns:
        true, if this driver is the best choice

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of the driver for logging purposes.
        Returns:
        the name of the driver

      • getPorts

        java.util.Collection<PortDescription> getPorts()
        Returns the available ports and their properties.
        Returns:
        the port properties

      • getAll

        java.util.Collection<SimpleData> getAll()
        Returns the states and values of all available ports.
        Returns:
        the state and value of all available ports

      • set

        boolean set(java.lang.String port,
            java.lang.Number value)
     throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Sets the output of an actor.
        Parameters:
        port - the name of the port
        value - the new output value
        Returns:
        true, if the port was set correctly
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the port is not known or a sensor port
